unnormalised: **Environmental News: Rethinking Raddi - Waste Management Gets a Desi Twist**
normalised: **environmental news: rethinking raddi - waste management gets a desi twist**

unnormalised: Hey everyone! Ever wonder where all that newspaper and plastic Diwali wrapping goes after the celebrations? Well, waste management is getting a serious makeover in Mumbai!
normalised: hey everyone! ever wonder where all that newspaper and plastic diwali wrapping goes after the celebrations? well, waste management is getting a serious makeover in mumbai!

unnormalised: BMC announced new initiatives focusing on segregation at source, inspired by the success stories in Indore. Remember how clean that city is? Imagine Mumbai like that!
normalised: B M C announced new initiatives focusing on segregation at source, inspired by the success stories in indore. remember how clean that city is? imagine mumbai like that!

unnormalised: The 'Kachra Free Mumbai' campaign, launched on 15/08/2023, aims to reduce landfill waste by 40% by next year. Big plans include more composting units in every ward and encouraging 'raddiwalas' to upgrade their collection methods.
normalised: the 'kachra free mumbai' campaign, launched on fifteenth august two thousand and twenty three, aims to reduce landfill waste by forty percent by next year. big plans include more composting units in every ward and encouraging 'raddiwalas' to upgrade their collection methods.

unnormalised: Residents are encouraged to separate wet and dry waste by 09:00 hrs every day. Fines will be levied on those who don't, but don't worry, training workshops are being held to help everyone understand the process.
normalised: residents are encouraged to separate wet and dry waste by nine o'clock every day. fines will be levied on those who don't, but don't worry, training workshops are being held to help everyone understand the process.

unnormalised: Dr. Sharma from IIT-Delhi is heading a study on converting plastic waste into usable fuel. He estimates a pilot plant can process 100 tonnes of plastic a day! Imagine the possibilities!
normalised: doctor sharma from I I T-delhi is heading a study on converting plastic waste into usable fuel. he estimates a pilot plant can process one hundred tonnes of plastic a day! imagine the possibilities!

unnormalised: And guess what? Many schools are now incorporating waste management into their curriculum, teaching kids the importance of recycling and reducing waste. The future looks bright, one properly sorted bin at a time! Remember the Swachh Bharat Abhiyan promise? Let's make it happen by 26/01/2024!
normalised: and guess what? many schools are now incorporating waste management into their curriculum, teaching kids the importance of recycling and reducing waste. the future looks bright, one properly sorted bin at a time! remember the swachh bharat abhiyan promise? let's make it happen by twenty sixth january two thousand and twenty four!
